conclusion: To determine if Car A is ahead of or behind Car B at t=10s, compare the distances traveled by each car from t=0s to t=10s.
The area under the v-t graph represents the displacement of the car.
The two cars are side by side at t=30s.
Calculate the displacement of Car A from t=0s to t=30s.
For Car A, the velocity is constant at 40 m/s from t=10s to t=30s, and it accelerates from 0 m/s to 40 m/s in the first 10s.
The displacement of Car A at t=30s is the area under its graph up to t=30s.
Area A = (Area of triangle from t=0s to t=10s) + (Area of rectangle from t=10s to t=30s).
Calculate the displacement of Car B from t=0s to t=30s.
For Car B, the velocity increases linearly from 0 m/s at t=0s to some velocity v_B at t=30s.
Since both cars are side by side at t=30s, their displacements from t=0s to t=30s must be equal.
Displacement of B at t=30s = 1000 m.
The displacement of Car B is the area of the triangle from t=0s to t=30s.
Find the equation for the velocity of Car B: v_B(t) = (v_B(30 s)/30 s) * t = (200/3)/30 * t = 20/9 t m/s.
Calculate the displacement of Car A at t=10s.
